sn46.21:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and said to him:
sn46.21:2.2: How are the awakening factors defined?”
sn46.21:2.3: “Mendicant, they’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.
sn46.21:2.4: A mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,
sn46.21:2.5: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.21:2.6: They’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.”
